H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H2377.def: = series of pictures or events in mind of sleeping person; ≈ associated with things that disappear in a moment

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7072.def: = attitude by which deities insist on receiving the attention and commitment that is in keeping with one's status

H5358.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H5201.def: = causative action by which humans make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5352.def: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which a city is deprived of its inhabitants

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5492.def: = process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

H8183.def: = a strong movement of air, ► causing destruction; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God

H6051.def: = a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

H80.def: = finely powdered substance, laying on the ground or on other objects or carried about by the wind; ◄ consisting of earth, soot, or other material; ≈ often associated with conditions that are transitory and do not endure

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1605.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H2717.def: = process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible

H1316.def: = region; ◄ north-east of the River {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}, ► at one time ruled by king {L:Og<SDBH:עֹוג>}, later assigned to half of the tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H3760.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour

H535.def: = state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H4127.def: = process by which a relatively hard object becomes softer

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H8398.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H2740.def: = process by which objects become extremely dry ► and therefore highly inflammable

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H5413.def: = process by which water flows from heaven in the form of rain

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4581.def: = large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2620.def: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3617.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3617.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3002.def: = state in which objects are free from moisture

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H1100.def: possible literal meaning: without benefit or without success; hence:  = state in which someone is considered an objectional human being who is engaged in evil behavior and does not contribute to the society in a positive way

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H1494.def: = causative action by which humans cut off their hair, or the wool of a sheep or other animal

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H4132.def: = long wooden pole ► for carrying heavy objects from one location to another

H4147.def: = material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H6459.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H4541.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1319.def: = action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

H2287.def: = action by which humans move about in an unsteady way ◄ like someone who is drunk

H2282.def: = celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H5088.def: = action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity

H1100.def: possible literal meaning: without benefit or without success; hence:  = state in which someone is considered an objectional human being who is engaged in evil behavior and does not contribute to the society in a positive way

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object
